headline: Showroom / Warehouse | International Tenant | Impressive Return
shortDescription: Our first purchase! It's a showroom / warehouse leased to Nutrien – a global leader in agricultural services and products.
longDescription:
The Property comprises a large commercial amalgamated parcel with frontage to a section of the current Bruce Highway, comprising six adjoining allotments forming a retail / industrial complex within the Central Queensland regional city of Rockhampton. Structural improvements include a single storey clear span warehouse with adjacent offices and retail accommodation, internal mezzanine storage and a front patio area.

The complex is a well presented and well maintained structure with a functional, efficient layout. The office and retail areas compliment the large warehouse space with the mezzanine level providing internal storage in addition to the outdoor hardstand storage space available. Site improvements include concrete driveway and hardstand surrounds, security fencing and on site designated car parking bays. Access and exposure is considered good with customer car parking and access to the office / retail areas via the Gladstone Road frontage. The site also has boundary to Stanley Street with additional driveway access off this roadway.

headline: Office / Warehouse | A-Grade Building | Prominent Location
shortDescription: An A-grade modern high-tech industrial facility that was built in 2012. It is leased to a manufacturer that specialises in the design, development and manufacture of a diverse range of electronic products for local and global markets.
longDescription:
The property comprises a 4,183 square metre Industry 'General Industry' classified landholding located within a 'community titled' industrial subdivision situated on the eastern side of Leitchs Road, Brendale. The subject property is situated to the Leitchs Road frontage to the northern side of common road access driveway for the subdivision.

The property is improved with a modern industrial facility that was completed in 2012. The building provides a gross lettable area of 3,000 square metres, comprising 1,500 square metres of office / laboratory accommodation and 1,500 square metres of warehouse accommodation. The office accommodation is arranged two levels, providing open plan and partitioned areas in addition to staff amenities. The warehouse component provides clearspan accommodation, with access via 2 container height roller shutters to the southern building alignment covered by awnings. The warehouse component includes a partitioned offices and a workshop area which has external access via a roller door in addition to a mezzanine level of 67 square metres (not included with GLA).

Ancillary site improvements include reinforced concrete hardstand facilitating on site manoeuvrability for heavy vehicles and on site car parking arranged adjacent to the main office component and soft landscaping.

headline: International Tenant | Melbourne Metro Asset | Brand Name Dealership
shortDescription: Our first acquisition in Victoria, this car dealership is located in busy Narre Warren. It is leased to an international tenant.
longDescription:
The property is located in Narre Warren - an established residential area situated approximately 40 radial kilometres south east of Melbourne's CBD. The site comprises a two-storey purpose built car dealership (showroom and workshop) constructed circa 2006 that is leased to an Australian subsidiary of Inchcape Plc (which has a market cap of £2.66b is listed on the London Stock Exchange). Inchcape Australasia have the distribution rights to Subaru in Australia, and also control the retail Subaru sales network by owning most of the dealerships (especially in Victoria where they own all bar two small dealerships).

The Property comprises 4,062m² of land, and buildings of 1,331m² that comprise showroom/offices and a service area. There is parking for 106 outdoor display / parking places. The site is leased until 5 December 2026, with 2 × 5 year options.

headline: Retail | Strategic Value Site
shortDescription: This might be a surprising asset to see in our portfolio, but it holds strategic future value as it is located next door to 66 Gladstone Road.
longDescription:
This is not the sort of property a retail fund would normally be interested in, however the site holds strategic value for us as it is located next door to 66 Gladstone Road. The purchase also prevents another purchaser acquiring the site to the detriment of our larger investment next door.

Shortly after purchase the tenant exercised their option to extend the lease by a further five years. Once that terms has ended we will consider demolishing the building to increase the hardstand area of 66 Gladstone Road, or possibly erecting a billboard.

headline: Strong Retail Asset | Long Lease | Brand Name Tenant
shortDescription: A recently modernised high profile retail building located in Moonah - just 7kms from Hobart's CBD. It commands a sought-after corner position with ample off-street parking in Moonah's prime shopping district.
longDescription:
The site comprises a regular shaped allotment on the corner of Main Road and Florence Street, that is generally level throughout. The site has a good profile to passing pedestrian and vehicular traffic. Accommodation comprises a split level, "L" shaped showroom, goods inwards / delivery areas, staff amenities, low clearance mezzanine store and a higher clearance mezzanine store.

The property comprises a recently modernised retail showroom with open plan retail, ground floor storeroom, staff room and toilets with two upper level mezzanine store areas. The original building was constructed in 1960's then later extended in 2010 and 2013. There is concrete paved onsite parking with access from Florence Street.

address: 68 Pimpama Jacobs Well Road, Pimpama, QLD 4209
headline: Growth Area | Long Leases | Attractive Return
shortDescription: Strategically nestled in the high-growth corridor between Brisbane and the Gold Coast, this multi-tenant retail site is anchored by a Caltex service station on an initial lease until 2035 with options through to 2055.
longDescription:
Pimpama, in the busy Brisbane - Gold Coast corridor, approximately 30kms north-west of Southport CBD and 51kms south-east of the Brisbane CBD, is (reported to be) the fastest growing area in Australia (with exception of capital cities). The property is situated on a high profile 3,292m2 (corner site) on the south-eastern intersection of Pimpama Jacobs Well Road and Attenborough Boulevard. The site is zoned 'Centre' under the Gold Coast Planning Scheme 2003 (version 1.2 amended November 2011). This zoning has re-development potential to 27m (estimated to be 9 stories in height (STCA)).

The property comprises a single level retail building containing three attached tenancies, with the building positioned towards the southern end of the site.

Improvements include Caltex Service station with 32 bowsers facilitating 8 vehicle service points and a tank capacity of 180,000 litres. The service station provides a convenience retail store of 151m2 in area and a connected 252m2 metre canopy which is 4.5metres in height. The convenience store has console, coolroom, back office, storeroom and bathroom amenities.

Adjoining the Caltex retail store is a 95m2 store leased to The Cheesecake Shop. The third adjoining tenancy with a lettable area of 158m2, is leased to Ramen Danbo (Japanese Noodles), and includes two drive thru windows and a queuing capacity for 13 vehicles.

The Cheesecake Shop includes front counter and servery with back of house kitchen and bathroom amenities. Ramen Danbo includes front counter and waiting area, internal seating, customer bathroom, commercial kitchen, cold room, drive-thru windows and staff bathroom.

headline: Retail (Showroom)
shortDescription: The property is a marquee Mazda car dealership located in Berserker; North Rockhampton, and an adjoining parcel of land that is used as a holding yard / used car sales. The property is leased to Capricorn Motors PTY Ltd, trustee of a unit trust.
longDescription:
The property is a marquee Mazda car dealership located in Berserker; North Rockhampton, and an adjoining parcel of land that is used as a holding yard / used car sales. The building has a gross lettable area of 1,546m² (ground floor 1,356m², first floor 190 m²) providing a main lot site coverage of 32%. The two-parcel site area is 4,940m².

The property is leased to Capricorn Motors PTY Ltd, trustee of a unit trust. Those units are owned by Autopact, (in who a majority stake was recently acquired by Optimus Group Co. Ltd); a ¥52.8b publicly listed company on the Tokyo Stock Exchange, headquartered in Tokyo. It has automotive business interests in Japan, Australia and New Zealand.

There is annual 3% fixed increases, with 5% cap/collar market reviews on exercise of options. There are two 5-year options.

A combination of a secure tenant, long-term lease, and net lease makes this an attractive purchase for the Fund.

headline: Retail (Showroom)
shortDescription: The Property comprises a single-storey 'big box' building format noted as 'showroom' on the Certificate of Classification. The property was built in approximately 2001. The building is presently leased to Officeworks (Officeworks Limited) on a lease that expires on 6 June 2029 (as amended).
longDescription:
The Property comprises a single-storey 'big box' building format noted as 'showroom' on the Certificate of Classification. The property was built in approximately 2001. It has a gross lettable area of 2,237m²; the site area is 4,048m² (resulting in a site coverage of 55%). There are 44 off-street car spaces, with overflow to street parking.

The building is presently leased to Officeworks (Officeworks Limited) on a lease that expires on 6 June 2029 (as amended), resulting in a WALE of circa 5.1 years. There are 3 x 5 year options thereafter. Officeworks is a brand name tenant who is owned by Wesfarmers (listed on the ASX).

headline: Showroom/Car Wash
shortDescription: The property is a prominent corner location at the intersection of Emerald's two main roads – the Capricorn Highway (A4), known as Clermont Street in Emerald, and the Gregory Highway (A7), known as Ruby Street. The A4 runs from West East connecting Longreach to Rockhampton (via Emerald). The A7 runs north south connecting Roma with Clermont.
longDescription:
The property is a prominent corner location at the intersection of Emerald's two main roads – the Capricorn Highway (A4), known as Clermont Street in Emerald, and the Gregory Highway (A7), known as Ruby Street. The A4 runs from West East connecting Longreach to Rockhampton (via Emerald). The A7 runs north south connecting Roma with Clermont.

The property is improved by two structures – a multi-bay car wash, and a showroom / sales office for an independent used car dealership. The car wash lease expires Feb 2032 (with two x 5-year options), and the car dealership is a five-year lease (with one x 5-year option), and the car dealership is currently being marketed for lease.

The combination of this prime location, with medium-term income and an attractive cap rate, makes this an attractive purchase for the Fund.

A combination of a secure tenant, long-term lease, and net lease makes this an attractive purchase for the Fund.

headline: Showroom/Car Wash
shortDescription: The property forms part of the large regional centre of Traralgon, located in and governed by the Latrobe Shire Council. Traralgon is situated on the Princes Highway and is approximately 165 kilometres east of the Melbourne CBD. Traralgon includes a variety of education providers and levels, a number of sporting facilities and recreation activities, and parks and gardens, as well as the Latrobe Regional Hospital.
longDescription:
5535 Princes Highway has two dealership buildings: MG/Suzuki in one building, and Land Rover/Jaguar in another. The property has prominent Princes Highway frontage on the Melbourne approach to Traralgon, accessible via a service road. This service road access is considered a benefit.

The property forms part of the large regional centre of Traralgon, located in and governed by the Latrobe Shire Council. Traralgon is situated on the Princes Highway and is approximately 165 kilometres east of the Melbourne CBD. Traralgon includes a variety of education providers and levels, a number of sporting facilities and recreation activities, and parks and gardens, as well as the Latrobe Regional Hospital.

The site is leased to an entity controlled by Motus Holdings Limited (JSE:MTH) which has a reported market cap of 21.29n ZAR (USD1,206,242,645).

The property is subject to a lease to "VSL Motors Pty Ltd" (subsidiary of "Motus Australia") that commenced 1 January 2019 for an initial term of 10 years with 5+5 year options thereafter.

The combination of this prime location, with medium-term income and an attractive cap rate, makes this an attractive purchase for the Fund.

headline: Showroom
shortDescription: 530 Yaamba Road Norman Gardens Qld is tenanted by AMart Furniture. The property has prominent Yaamba Road (Bruce Highway) frontage, Yaamba Road stretches 37km from North Rockhampton to Yaamba. The property comprises a "Specialised Centre" zoned large commercial inside allotment frontage to a section of the current Bruce Highway in a busy commercial and retail precinct in the North Rockhampton suburb of Norman Gardens, on the northern fringe of the Central Queensland city of Rockhampton.
longDescription:
530 Yaamba Road Norman Gardens Qld is tenanted by AMart Furniture. The property has prominent Yaamba Road (Bruce Highway) frontage, Yaamba Road stretches 37km from North Rockhampton to Yaamba.

The property comprises a "Specialised Centre" zoned large commercial inside allotment frontage to a section of the current Bruce Highway in a busy commercial and retail precinct in the North Rockhampton suburb of Norman Gardens, on the northern fringe of the Central Queensland city of Rockhampton.

The site is leased to AMart Furniture Pty Limited (AMart), which is ultimately owned by BBQSam Holdings Pty Ltd, which in turn is owned by a consortium of private equity parties. The lease commenced on 09/06/2021 and has a term of 8 years, expiring on 08/06/2029 with a 1 x 5 year option.

The combination of this prime location, with medium-term income and an attractive cap rate, makes this an attractive purchase for the Fund.

The property forms part of the large regional centre of Traralgon, located in and governed by the Latrobe Shire Council. Traralgon is situated on the Princes Highway and is approximately 165 kilometres east of the Melbourne CBD.

headline: Retail (Showroom)
shortDescription: 1051 - 1099 Howitt Street Wendouree has prominent exposure on Howitt Street and is only 2.5km from the Ballarat CBD. Ballarat is located approximately 115km north-west of Melbourne at the junction of the Western Freeway, Glenelg Highway and Midland Highway. Ballarat is the second largest regional city in Victoria after Geelong. The property is situated on the south side of Howitt Street in Wendouree which is a northern suburb of Ballarat. The site is leased to Carworks Australia and comprises a dealer group of Chrysler-Jeep, Renault and used car sales.
longDescription:
1051 - 1099 Howitt Street Wendouree has prominent exposure on Howitt Street and is only 2.5km from the Ballarat CBD.

Ballarat is located approximately 115km north-west of Melbourne at the junction of the Western Freeway, Glenelg Highway and Midland Highway. Ballarat is the second largest regional city in Victoria after Geelong. The property is situated on the south side of Howitt Street in Wendouree which is a northern suburb of Ballarat.

The site is leased to Carworks Australia and comprises a dealer group of Chrysler-Jeep, Renault and used car sales.

The combination of location, with short-medium term income and an attractive cap rate, makes this an attractive purchase for the Fund.

headline: Retail (Showroom)
shortDescription: 731 - 735 Deception Bay Road Rothwell has multiple dealership buildings housing Kia and Subaru. The property has prominent Deception Bay Road frontage travelling towards Northlakes from the Redcliffe Peninsula. The property in positioned in a well established commercial precinct with high traffic volumes, located in and governed by the Moreton Bay Regional Council. Rothwell is situated 40km north east of the Brisbane CBD.
longDescription:
731 - 735 Deception Bay Road Rothwell has multiple dealership buildings housing Kia and Subaru. The property has prominent Deception Bay Road frontage travelling towards Northlakes from the Redcliffe Peninsula.

The property in positioned in a well established commercial precinct with high traffic volumes, located in and governed by the Moreton Bay Regional Council. Rothwell is situated 40km north east of the Brisbane CBD.

The site is leased to Autopact who own and operate 35 dealerships along the eastern seaboard, representing 39 top vehicle brands in Australia.

The combination of this prime location, with medium-term income and an attractive cap rate, makes this an attractive purchase for the Fund.

headline: Retail (Showroom)
shortDescription: 247 Morayfield Road Morayfield has multiple dealership buildings housing Mitsubishi, Kia and Subaru. The property has prominent Morayfield Road frontage on the Brisbane approach to Morayfield. The property forms part of the large regional centre of Morayfield, located in and governed by the Moreton Bay Regional Council. Morayfield is situated 45km north of the Brisbane CBD. Morayfield has a population of around 25,000 and has a significant commercial hub encompassing businesses and food and retail outlets.
